content: Yes, I'm familiar with the artwork for David Bowie's "Heroes" album. The artwork was created by Jonathan Barnbrook, a British graphic designer who has worked on numerous other album covers and designs for various bands and artists. The artwork for "Heroes" features a minimalist representation of a white square with the word "Heroes" in black, with the "e" slightly shifted to create an unexpected element. This design was intended to be disruptive and subversive, reflecting the album's themes of rebellion and experimentation. Barnbrook's work on the "Heroes" artwork has been widely praised for its minimalist and inventive design, which has since become iconic in its own right.
